Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; two rows of lotus buds in added white outline with added red centres with two white lines between; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion (snout and front paw remaining) to right, between pairs of lines.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (on the evidence of being included in Petrie 1886, pl. V.)
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 298, no. 990)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 3 (interior))
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1989) (phase 2)
